record.title: QUESTION OF PERSONAL PRIVILEGE
record.narrative:
QUESTION OF PERSONAL PRIVILEGE -- (House of Representatives - October 23, 2007)

[Page: H11854]

speaking.paragraph: Madam Speaker, I rise to a question of personal privilege.

record.chair: The gentleman has apprised the Chair of media accounts that give rise to a question of personal privilege under rule IX.
The gentleman from California is recognized for 1 hour.

speaking.paragraph: Madam Speaker, I yield myself such time as I may consume.

record.narrative: (Mr. STARK asked and was given permission to revise and extend his remarks.)

speaking.paragraph: In a very serious note, and I won't take the hour, I want to apologize to, first of all, my colleagues, many of whom I have offended, to the President, to his family, to the troops that may have found in my remarks, as were suggested in the motion that we just voted on, and I do apologize.
For this reason, I think that we have a serious issue before us, the issue of providing medical care to children, the issue of what we do about a war that we are divided about how to end.
I hope that with this apology, I will become as insignificant as I should be and that we can return to the issues that do divide us, but that we can resolve in a better fashion.
Madam Speaker, I yield back the balance of my time.
